channel.title: Ffs..compiling >.<
channel.description:
Wth..
The compiler i had for syscape server did not work. So i've tried like 5 different compilers and none of them work i get some weird message.. So, could someone help me make a compilers that WILL WORK? Or tell me how to..
Don't give me shit comments saying im a retard, i know i am =D lol idk much about compilers and how to do this so if someone could help me it would be nice.
~Moto

item.description:
@Motokid126 wrote:

Ok i’ll try it, it works yes but it doesn’t work, nothing is taking effect in game.

Yes it does Chassy

item.title: Ffs..compiling >.<
item.dc:creator: @FusionLord FusionLord
item.description:
@FusionLord wrote:

try this it works for all versions of java.

@echo off
COLOR 09
@echo -----------------------
if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
exit

Read full topic

item.title: Ffs..compiling >.<
item.dc:creator: @Motokid126 Motokid126
item.description:
@Motokid126 wrote:

It’s just noob delta, so all in one folder, source folder. Then its all broken down into the .cfg folder’s characters, etc etc.

EDIT: Ok, i just got it to work but, when ever i actually compile, i get no errors, but the thing is, its not taking effect in game. I compile, close my server, restart open it up, log in and nothing has changed. so something is still not right

Read full topic

item.title: Ffs..compiling >.<

item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Where are you placing your compiler, and are your java files located in seperate folders or all in a single folder?

item.title: Ffs..compiling >.<
item.dc:creator: @Motokid126 Motokid126
item.description:
@Motokid126 wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:6, topic:335179”]Well, a perfect example of this is a 508 server.

The compiler contains a path such as this:

@echo off
cd …/src
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_10\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./palidino76/rs2/model/update/*.java
pause[/quote]

Hmm, well this is a 317

This is what i see most compilers have:
@echo off
title Compile
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause
@echo Finished!

They all seem to work fine, but for some reason its not on this

Read full topic

item.title: Ffs..compiling >.<
item.dc:creator: @Motokid126 Motokid126
item.description:
@Motokid126 wrote:

Ah ok, how exactly could i make the path so that it could find the files to compile? I’ve never done that lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Ffs..compiling >.<
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

It cannot find any java files to compile. Make sure the java files are in the same location as the compiler, or that you create a path to the folder containing your files.

Read full topic

item.title: Ffs..compiling >.<
item.dc:creator: @Motokid126 Motokid126
item.description:
@Motokid126 wrote:

Chassy13:

Exactly what is this error? You can also check the compiler error sticky in this section, it’s very possible that your question has been asked and answered before.

javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .

I have checked it, went through several pages, tried out compliers people offered and i keep getting that error or maybe a little bit changed up. Not sure what the deal is but i’m not sure how to fix it

Read full topic
